intro: Erodium commutatum, commonly known as common erodium, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and features small, pink to purple flowers that bloom from spring to early summer. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces small, dry fruits called utricles that contain seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in dry, open habitats. Botanically, it is characterized by its simple stem, hairy foliage, and its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
